intro: Gardoquia revoluta, commonly known as the revolute gardoquia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
